So here we go. The spoilers. Any spoiler will be in RED. My thoughts about them in BLUE.

  1. Dumbledore dies by Snape's hand in the Astronomy Tower as the other Death Eaters look on. Snape had to do it. I don't see how he couldn't get around it. He had the Unbreakable Vow with Narcissa and possibly one with Dumbledore. Either way, he had to do it. If not, he would've died (because Draco possibly would've died if he tried). Also, with the disgusted look - I know I'd be disgusted if I had to kill someone that I cared for. Also, if he didn't he would've been suspected and killed by Voldemort. Which wouldn't have worked well with the last book. I do pretty much agree with what spoilers I've read tonight by different people on my flist.
  2. Snape is the Half-Blood Prince and Harry gets ahold of the potion book with the Half-Blood Prince's signature in it. I could see that making perfect sense after reading the book. So I guess I was half right in my guess a few days ago. It was a Slytherin, just the wrong one. After I read Chapter 9, ironically titled The Half-Blood Prince, and realized it was a potion's book with that inscription I kinda knew it was Snape. I mean, he is the best potion's master (as far as we know) in the wizarding world. And I think that Snape most definately knew that Harry had gotten ahold of the book somehow. Of course, it didn't help matters any that Horace Slughorn compared them to each other in Ch. 15. That and after Harry used the curse Sectusempra (Ch. 24). My only question is: Why did Severus let Harry keep the book? He had to have known that Harry would've hidden it so he couldn't get his hands on it. Maybe because he knew that Harry had the power to cast a Dark Curse and could possibly kill Voldemort.
  3. Chapter 23 - Horcruxes. We know that Dumbledore knew at least what some of them are/were. First, we have Slytherin's necklace that his mother owned, along with the Gaunt's Family Ring that his Grandfather (Marvolo) owned. We also know that Tom Riddle's Diary was one (now), and possibly Nagini could be one as well, for the simple facts that Dumbledore gave. Hufflepuff's cup may be one for the simple fact that it belonged to a place that he wanted to stay at. That leaves 2 left. One I know has to be Voldemort himself. The part that Harry didn't destroy when Voldemort casts the killing curse at him. I think the last one may be either something of Ravenclaws or even the Black Family Ring. I'd have to check, but maybe the Black's were descendants of Ravenclaw and that could be the last clue. It would explain why J.K.R. wrote about Mungdus having the ring and Harry noticing it quickly. Then again I could just be thinking hard. We know that Voldemort killed 6 people before Harry (including Harry's parents) and that Nagini killed one in the 4th book. That totals 7 horcruxes. Two have been destroyed. 5 more to go.
  4. The letter that was in the locket that was at the cave. Signed R.A.B. Regulus Black sounds like a good guess, which makes me think that it could be the ring and that's why Regulus died (but that's for a whole other post). Then again it could be another character we've never met (but I doubt it). *shrugs*
  5. Snape FINALLY gets the DADA job and the the new character takes over potions. I think that should've thrown everyone into a big loop, thinking that Snape might die because that job's cursed (which we now know to be true) or something else, like killing Dumbledore for example, which means that we've lost another DADA teacher. Damn curse. I was just starting to like having Sev teach the class and he has to go and be all "Gryffindor" all of the sudden. *snorts into tea* Already discussed that p.o.v.

And that's it for now. 5 wonderful spoilers and my thoughts on them. Pretty good for someone who never types long posts. :D Have fun reading/writing.
